mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Francis H. Pierpont Civil War Telegrams
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Roberts, Benjamin Stone to Pierpont, Francis Harrison
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Roberts, Benjamin Stone
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Gov Peirpoint [Francis H. Pierpont] Wheeling May 4 1863. By Telegraph from Clarksburg 4 1863. One (1) of the most reliable union men of the country just in from Weston informs me that Imboden with Jacksons and Jenkins forces occupied that place on sunday in force his belief is they expect large reinforcements and intend to hold the country the militia must be called out [page 2] and marched to Protect this rail road to enable me to move against the enemy we need three thousand 3000 militia to protect the road from Grafton to Parkersburg you must make extraordinary exertions or your railroad will be cut up & your new state endangered answer what you can do BS Roberts Brig Genl Comdg 98De299pd
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Roberts, Benjamin Stone
Clarksburg, (West) Virginia
Wheeling, (West) Virginia
Pierpont, Francis Harrison
